result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Case Called: 11:01 am
INCLUDES 22CF965 & 22CM112.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski in person. Defendant does not appear. Atty Greg Venturini appears in person on behalf of the Defendant.
VRCW.
Date and time set for a Competency Hearing.
Court notes per the letter that was filed that the Examiner was unable to evaluate the Defendant and the Examiner is requesting extended time to complete the report. 
Atty Venturini makes statements regarding the Defendant's whereabouts. 
State has no objection to rescheduling this matter; Court has no objection to rescheduling this matter. 
DATES: Court directs the parties back to the Judicial Assistant to reschedule this matter.
Adjourned: 11:02 am
Extension request from WFU

Clerk: Amy.

INCLUDES 22CF965, 22CM112.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ with Atty Venturini. 

Date and time set for review hearing re: competency.

State takes no position on matter. 
COURT makes findings and orders defendant submit to examination of competency.

Atty Venturini will submit order. 

COURT directs parties to get review hearing date from Judicial Assistant.

Review hearing on September 29, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Date and time set for bond modification hearing; VRCW.  
Atty Venturini make bond arguments. 
ADA Zibolski makes objections.

COURT makes findings and denies bond modification.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Greg Venturini

No contact with victim(s): S.L. their residence or their dog; R.J. or their residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:07 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears from MCJ via Zoom, with Atty Greg Venturini, in person.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

COURT ORDERS: $1,500.00 cash bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): S.L. their residence or their dog; R.J. or their residence.
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
RH: 8/10/22 @ 1:00 p.m. w/CC Baumann.
PH: 8/15/22 @ 9:30 a.m. 
JPTC: 8/11/22 @ 3:45 p.m.
